info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 11:21PM EDT until July 10 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties, Charlotte and Halifax.
* WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicates steady light rain continues this evening. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this evening, the runoff of which continues to collect in local creeks and streams, holding them at or slightly above bankfull water levels. Localized minor flooding is expected to persist over the next few hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Buckskin Creek, Austin Creek, Buffalo Creek, Black Walnut Creek, Bentleys Branch, Bluestone Creek, Banister River and Ash Camp Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Boston... Halifax... Keysville... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... Clover... Redoak... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
